Package org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request

Interface ResponseMessage

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CertificateResponseMessage
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CmpErrorResponseMessage, CmpResponseMessage, ScepResponseMessage, X509ResponseMessage
    public interface ResponseMessage
extends Serializable
    Base interface for response messages sent from the CA. Implementors of this interface must also implement Serializable if they are to be sent to any EJB business methods. Example: ResponseMessage resp = new ResponseMessage(); resp.setCertificate(cert); resp.setStatus(OK); if (resp.requireSignKeyInfo()) { resp.setSignKeyInfo(signcert,signkey) }; resp.create(); byte[] responseMessage = resp.getResponseMessage();
    Version:
    $Id: ResponseMessage.java 20516 2015-01-08 17:26:01Z mikekushner $

      • setCrl

        void setCrl​(CRL crl)
        Sets the CRL (if present) in the response message.
        Parameters:
        crl - crl in the response message.

      • setIncludeCACert

        void setIncludeCACert​(boolean incCACert)
        Determines if the CA certificate should be included in the response message, if applicable for the response message type.
        Parameters:
        incCACert - true or false

      • setCACert

        void setCACert​(Certificate caCert)
        Explicitly sets the CA certificate if it is not the same as the signer certificate. Used if IncludeCACert is set to true and the CA certificate is not the same as the signer certificate.
        Parameters:
        caCert - a Certificate

      • getResponseMessage

        byte[] getResponseMessage()
                   throws CertificateEncodingException
        Gets the response message in the default encoding format.
        Returns:
        the response message in the default encoding format.
        Throws:
        CertificateEncodingException - if encoding of certificate fails.

      • create

        boolean create()
        throws InvalidKeyException,
               NoSuchAlgorithmException,
               NoSuchProviderException,
               CertificateEncodingException,
               CRLException
        Create encrypts and creates signatures as needed to produce a complete response message. If needed setSignKeyInfo must be called before this method. After this is called the response message can be retrieved with getResponseMessage();
        Returns:
        True if signature/encryption was successful, false if it failed, request should not be sent back it failed.
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - If the key used for signing/encryption is invalid.
        NoSuchProviderException - if there is an error with the Provider.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the signature on the request is done with an unhandled algorithm.
        CertificateEncodingException - if there is a problem extracting the certificate information.
        CRLException - if there is a problem extracting the CRL information

      • requireSignKeyInfo

        boolean requireSignKeyInfo()
        indicates if this message needs recipients public and private key to sign. If this returns true, setSignKeyInfo() should be called.
        Returns:
        True if public and private key is needed.

      • setSignKeyInfo

        void setSignKeyInfo​(Collection<Certificate> certs,
                    PrivateKey key,
                    String provider)
        Sets the public and private key needed to sign the message. Must be set if requireSignKeyInfo() returns true.
        Parameters:
        certs - certificate containing the public key.
        key - private key.
        provider - the provider to use, if the private key is on a HSM you must use a special provider. If null is given, the default BC provider is used.
        See Also:
        requireSignKeyInfo()

      • setSenderNonce

        void setSenderNonce​(String senderNonce)
        Sets a senderNonce if it should be present in the response
        Parameters:
        senderNonce - a string of base64 encoded bytes

      • setRecipientNonce

        void setRecipientNonce​(String recipientNonce)
        Sets a recipient if it should be present in the response
        Parameters:
        recipientNonce - a string of base64 encoded bytes

      • setTransactionId

        void setTransactionId​(String transactionId)
        Sets a transaction identifier if it should be present in the response
        Parameters:
        transactionId - transaction id

      • setRecipientKeyInfo

        void setRecipientKeyInfo​(byte[] recipientKeyInfo)
        Sets recipient key info, key id or similar. This is usually the request key info from the request message.
        Parameters:
        recipientKeyInfo - key info

      • setPreferredDigestAlg

        void setPreferredDigestAlg​(String digest)
        Sets preferred digest algorithm for the response message, if applicable. If this is not called, a default is used.
        Parameters:
        digest - String oid of digest algorithm ex CMSSignedDataGenerator.SHA1, SHA256 etc

      • setRequestType

        void setRequestType​(int reqtype)
        Sometimes (CMP) the response identifier sent depends on which request identifier was used, even if the messages themselves are the same mesages.
        Parameters:
        reqtype - which type of request message this response is in response to

      • setRequestId

        void setRequestId​(int reqid)
        For some types of request-responses there is a need for a requetsId to match the request and the response together.
        Parameters:
        reqid - the id from the request matching to this response

      • setProtectionParamsFromRequest

        void setProtectionParamsFromRequest​(RequestMessage reqMsg)
        For some types of requests, the protection used depends on parameters from the request, for example password based protection where algorithms, keyId etc is the same in the response as in the request
        Parameters:
        reqMsg - the request from where to pick protection parameters
